result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Veronika A Schmadl in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charge is dismissed and read into 16CF172 and 16CF441.
Hearing on July 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Veronika A Schmadl in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    Kristie Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The State advises the Court that it will be filing new charges.  Attorney Weitzner requests huber bailee status and the State objects to any bail modification.  The Court does modify bail and bail remains as set.   The Court sets the case for a hearing in two weeks to address status of cases.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $225.00, NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $500.00.

Defendant Veronika A Schmadl in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the Defendant's non compliance with WCS.  Attorney Weitzner advises the Court the Defendant is scheduled to start a 20 week program and requests that court not increase cash bail.   The State is requesting the Court increase cash bail.   The Court increases cash bail by $500.00 on each case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 10:45 am.
